intro: Parosela exilis, commonly known as the slender parosela, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and finely divided leaves. The plant is known for its small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Parosela exilis is considered a species of conservation concern.
